1.name: All Quiet on the Western Front
1.description: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

2.name: Hell's Angels
2.description: Brothers Monte and Ray leave Oxford to join the Royal Flying Corps. Ray loves Helen; Helen enjoys an affair with Monte; before they leave on their mission over Germany they find her in still another man's arms.

3.name: The Big Trail
3.description: Breck Coleman leads hundreds of settlers in covered wagons from the Mississippi River to their destiny out West.

4.name: Der blaue Engel
4.description: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

5.name: L'âge d'or
5.description: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love with each other, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

6.name: Morocco
6.description: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the results of his womanizing and due to the appearance of a rich man who wants her for himself.

7.name: Murder!
7.description: A juror in a murder trial, after voting to convict, has second thoughts and begins to investigate on his own before the execution.

8.name: Little Rascals: Best of Our Gang
8.description: Spanky, Buckwheat, Porky and all The Little Rascals at their hilarious best!

9.name: Anna Christie
9.description: A young woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but struggles to tell them about her dark past.

10.name: Animal Crackers
10.description: Mayhem and zaniness ensue when a valuable painting goes missing during a party in honor of famed African explorer Captain Spaulding.

11.name: The Divorcee
11.description: When a woman discovers that her husband has been unfaithful to her, she decides to respond to his infidelities in kind.

12.name: Zemlya
12.description: In the peaceful countryside, Vassily opposes the rich kulaks over the coming of collective farming.

13.name: City Girl
13.description: A Chicago waitress falls in love with a Minnesota farmer, and decides to face a life in the country.

14.name: Westfront 1918: Vier von der Infanterie
14.description: A group of German infantrymen of the First World War live out their lives in the trenches of France. They find brief entertainment and relief in a village behind the lines, but primarily ...                See full summary »

15.name: Abraham Lincoln
15.description: An episodic biography of the 16th President of the United States.

16.name: Menschen am Sonntag
16.description: Two men and two women enjoy a pleasant Sunday at the beach amid the unending toil of the working week.

17.name: Just Imagine
17.description: New York, 1980: airplanes have replaced cars, numbers have replaced names, pills have replaced food, government-arranged marriages have replaced love, and test tube babies have replaced ......                See full summary »

18.name: Min and Bill
18.description: Min, the owner of a dockside hotel, is forced to make difficult decisions about the future of Nancy, the young woman she took in as an infant.

19.name: Holiday
19.description: Holiday is a 1930 American Pre-Code romantic comedy film which tells the story of a young man who is torn between his free-thinking lifestyle and the tradition of his wealthy fiancée's family.

20.name: The Unholy Three
20.description: "Talkie" remake of Tod Browning's 1925 silent film. A trio of former sideshow performers double as the "Unholy Three" in a scam to nab some shiny rocks.

21.name: The Big House
21.description: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.

22.name: King of Jazz
22.description: American Pre-Code color film starring Paul Whiteman and his Jazz orchestra.

23.name: Up the River
23.description: When paroled trustee Steve and former inmate Judy who try to put their criminal lives behind them are blackmailed, two career criminals come to their rescue.

24.name: Show Girl in Hollywood
24.description: 'Rainbow Girls' has just opened and closed on Broadway when Dixie, a actress in it, runs into smooth talking Hollywood Director Frank Buelow. He tells her she would be a natural, promises ...                See full summary »

25.name: Our Blushing Brides
25.description: Three department store girls--Connie, Franky, and Jerry--share an apartment on West 91st Street in New York City. Each earns little more than 20 dollars per week. Jerry is the sensible one,...                See full summary »

26.name: The Green Goddess
26.description: An airplane carrying three Brits--Major Crespin, his wife Lucille, and Dr. Trahern--crash lands in the kingdom of Rukh. The Rajah holds them prisoner because the British are about to ...                See full summary »

27.name: Sous les toits de Paris
27.description: Albert is smitten for Pola but ends up wrongly committed in jail, in the meantime her affections are sought after by his friend, and on his release both love and friendship must be tested.

28.name: Madam Satan
28.description: Angela and Bob Brooks are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, Bob is an unfaithful husband. But Angela has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to ...                See full summary »

29.name: Raffles
29.description: A distinguished English gentleman has a secret life--he is the notorious jewel thief the press has dubbed "The Amateur Cracksman". When he meets a woman and falls in love he decides to "...                See full summary »

30.name: Juno and the Paycock
30.description: During the Irish Civil War in 1922, a family earns a big inheritance. They start leading a rich life, forgetting what the most important values are.

31.name: The Doorway to Hell
31.description: Despite his efforts to go straight, a young gangster keeps falling back into crime.

32.name: The Dawn Patrol
32.description: World War I ace Dick Courtney derides the leadership of his superior officer, but Courtney is soon promoted to squadron commander and learns harsh lessons about sending subordinates to their deaths.

33.name: Moby Dick
33.description: In this extremely loose adaptation of Melville's classic novel, Ahab is revealed initially not as a bitter and vengeful madman, but as a bit of a lovable scamp. Ashore in New Bedford, he ...                See full summary »

34.name: The Rogue Song
34.description: In tsarist Russia, a princess falls for a dashing bandit leader, but their romance proves a stormy one.

35.name: Whoopee!
35.description: Western sheriff Bob Wells is preparing to marry Sally Morgan; she loves part-Indian Wanenis, whose race is an obstacle. Sally flees the wedding with hypochondriac Henry Williams, who thinks...                See full summary »

36.name: Montana Moon
36.description: While returning to Montana from a fling in New York, wealthy Joan Prescott leaves the train, intending to return to the big city. She runs into handsome cowboy Larry and gets engaged. On ...                See full summary »

37.name: Tom Sawyer
37.description: The classic Mark Twain tale of a young boy and his friends on the Mississippi River. Tom and his pals Huckleberry Finn and Joe Harper have numerous adventures, including running away to be ...                See full summary »

38.name: Paramount on Parade
38.description: A musical revue that basically has Paramount stars and contract-players doing things some had never done on screen, and wouldn't again; such as Ruth Chatteron , in a French-café setting ...                See full summary »

39.name: Prix de beauté (Miss Europe)
39.description: Lucienne, typist and gorgeous bathing beauty, decides to enter the 'Miss Europe' pageant sponsored by the French newspaper she works for. She finds her jealous lover Andre violently ...                See full summary »

40.name: Ladies of Leisure
40.description: An upper-crust artist hires a 'party girl' as a model; romance follows.

41.name: Sinners' Holiday
41.description: Ma Delano (La Verne) runs a boardwalk penny arcade, living upstairs with her sons (Cagney and Gallagher) and daughter (Knapp). Story involves rum running, accidental murder and a frame-up.

42.name: Soup to Nuts
42.description: Mr. Schmidt's costume store is bankrupt because he spends his time on Rube Goldberg-style inventions; the creditors send a young manager who falls for Schmidt's niece Louise, but she'll ...                See full summary »

43.name: Her Man
43.description: Havana bar girl with tough "protector" falls for young sailor.

44.name: The Bat Whispers
44.description: A master criminal terrorizes the occupants of an isolated country mansion.

45.name: Renegades
45.description: Four one-for-all and all-for-one privates in the French Foreign Legion are all in jail for disorderly conduct, but they break out and rejoin their regiment and fight off a band of marauding...                See full summary »

46.name: Romance
46.description: Young Harry is in love and wants to marry an actress, much to the displeasure of his family. Harry thinks that Bishop Armstrong knows nothing about love so Armstrong tells him the story of ...                See full summary »

47.name: The Widow from Chicago
47.description: Vice lord Dominic has brought Swifty Dorgan east to do a job for him. When Swifty appears to have died falling from a train, detective Henderson impersonates him hoping to get into the mob....                See full summary »

48.name: Runaway Bride
48.description: A young socialite and a rich playboy elope to Atlantic City. However, she soon realizes he's not the man she wants him to be and tries to call off the wedding. A jewelry store robbery, murder and other mayhem are soon involved.

49.name: Journey's End
49.description: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.

50.name: The Cat Creeps
50.description: Disappearances and strange goings-on in a spooky old mansion.
